title: Costs of Sceffolding inside and outside the Rose Garden Cafe, Graves Park, Sheffield

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Regarding the scaffolding erected inside the Rose Garden Cafe in Graves Park, erected in from last year, 2022:
1. Regarding the scaffolding/propping inside and outside the Rose Garden Café, how much is it costing a month to keep the scaffolding in place and what is the total that has been paid for this up to date?
2. We have heard that the scaffolding etc has been purchased by SCC. Can you confirm that this is the case and if so, how much did the Council pay for it?
3. Can you confirm who in the council, as in which department, is covering the costs for all of this?
4. Can you confirm that these costs will NOT be charged to the Graves Park Trust, nor deducted from the Graves Park Trust's accounts?
Yours faithfully,
Caroline Dewar

Dear Caroline Dewar,
Thank you for your request for information relating to costs of
scaffolding inside and outside the Rose Garden Café which we received on
26/10/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,

The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond

Yours sincerely,

Dear Caroline Dewar,
Thank you for your request for information relating to costs of
scaffolding inside and outside the Rose Garden Café which we received on
26/10/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. Regarding the scaffolding/propping inside and outside the Rose Garden
Café, how much is it costing a month to keep the scaffolding in place
and what is the total that has been paid for this up to date?
The interior and exterior scaffolding to Rose Garden Café was
initially hired for 12 weeks from December 2022. The total cost of
installing and hiring the scaffolding for this 12 week period was £61,008.
This included the costs for the legally required weekly inspections.
After the initial 12 week hire, it was determined that the scaffold would
need to be in place for a substantial period. The scaffolding supplier
quoted £6,800 per month to continue hiring the scaffolding. We asked the
supplier to allow us to purchase the scaffold instead. The supplier was
unwilling to sell the scaffolding but agreed that we could pay a one-off
hire fee of £50,000, allowing us to hire the scaffolding for the duration
of the project. Upon project completion the scaffolding would be returned
to the supplier.
The £50,000 did not include for the weekly inspection costs and the
scaffolding supplier undertook two further inspections of the scaffolding
on 29/05/23 and 05/06/23 at the cost of £300.
The total paid to the scaffolding supplier is £111,308.
Since 05/06/23, we have undertaken the mandatory inspections costing
£26.17 per inspection totalling £197.23 to date.
The total spent on the scaffolding to date is £111,505.23
2. We have heard that the scaffolding etc has been purchased by SCC. Can
you confirm that this is the case and if so, how much did the Council
pay for it?
Please see reply to question 1 above
3. Can you confirm who in the council, as in which department, is
covering the costs for all of this?
Facilities Management Revenue Budget
4. Can you confirm that these costs will NOT be charged to the Graves
Park Trust, nor deducted from the Graves Park Trust's accounts?
See response to question 3. Please also refer to the Rose Garden Café
